thread.title: Girls Born With Rare Condition Find Support In Each Other
thread.title_full: Girls Born With Rare Condition Find Support In Each Other

author: Selena John
title: Girls Born With Rare Condition Find Support In Each Other
text:
Follow Us On 
Juliana Wetmore is well-known around the world as "The Girl Born Without a Face." 
Since her birth, this American girl had to live in the dark as Treacher Collins syndrome (facial deformity), causing her face almost no part. Her story went viral just after a year she was born. Girls Born With Rare Condition Find Support In Each Other 754 396 
Juliana Wetmore was born with a condition called Treacher Collins syndrome. According to Genetics Home Reference, it "affects the development of bones and other tissues of the face." #2. Most Extreme Case Ever Recorded 
Her case is considered the most extreme ever recorded in history. When she was born, doctors believed she wouldn't make it through the night because she had trouble breathing. #3. One Eye Is Enough To See The Love 
Juliana was also born without bones in her ears making it nearly impossible for her to hear. She did have vision out of her right eye and could see the unconditional love her parents had for her. #4. Juliana Learns To Communicate 
Her family could not relate to her situation, but there was an orphan in Ukraine named Danica born with a much milder case of Treacher Collins syndrome. #6. Danica and Juliana Meet 
When Danica reached a certain age, the government was no longer obligated to take care of her, so she ended up on the streets. Juliana's family heard about Danica's situation and traveled to Ukraine to meet her. #7. Juliana Receives A Sister via 
The family immediately fell in love with her and made the decision to adopt her and take her back to the United States where she could live a life with someone who would be able to relate to her rare condition. #8. A Family Is Complete via 
They are now one big happy family that is full of support and love for each other. The two girls affected by the condition no longer have to go through life feeling as if there is no one out there who understands what they are going through. They are now sisters who will be able to support and understand one another until the end. Anyone suffering from Treacher Collins Syndrome should have equal right to live their life, isn't it? others like
